TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
On 14/04/2021 at 16:29, Beale said:

Sim, você pode abrir livremente Tantares / Parts /

e exclua todas as pastas de que você não precisa, se, por exemplo, quiser excluir os dois módulos de aterrissagem LK:

Hello Beale

I did the procedure as you said and it was very good.

Only who learns is wrong learns? So I tried to repeat this in the TANTARES LV mod. (It didn't quite work ... but I did a backup)

My intention is to keep only 3 rockets. ENERGIA-BURAN, Proton and Soyuz. This time WORKING 

What exactly should I do?

I'm using JNSQ(2.7x Kerbin) and I am having trouble with reentry of VA.

In theory the 2000k heat resistance of the capsule is enough for JNSQ atmosphere (which is 85000km, with minimum orbit velocity of 3850m/s).

And I tested the Making history Gemini which has a similar design with VA, and it just can survive the reentry.

Finally, I find that VA heat shield is not insulating the heat as good as stock ones.

Is it intended?

On 4/16/2021 at 6:31 PM, KallangoVerde said:

Hello Beale

I did the procedure as you said and it was very good.

Only who learns is wrong learns? So I tried to repeat this in the TANTARES LV mod. (It didn't quite work ... but I did a backup)

My intention is to keep only 3 rockets. ENERGIA-BURAN, Proton and Soyuz. This time WORKING 

What exactly should I do?

Should be the same, just select the folders you want to delete

Most of the Energia parts are in the ANY_FUEL_TANK/Energia folders etc. So make sure to keep those.

Seria possível abrir um problema do GitHub para não esquecer? Posso ajustar as propriedades de calor deste:

Can we give NK-33 a  shrouded variant and have a sea-level RD-120 for Soyuz 2-3 ? It would be a small tweak yet give possibility to many heavy payloads on basic Soyuz design.

Like Kliper and Parom or Progress M2 

Glory to the advanced soyuz LV!

Edited April 21, 2021 by Anachro

Can we have SMERCH？

It's a large LH2/LOX upper stage/space tug at first time as a modern replacement of Blok V for N1. Later it become a upper stage/interplanetary transfer stage for possible Lunar or Mars mission for Energia/Vulkan.

It would be similar to the existing N1 Blok V except it uses Tantares LH2 and having a Hydrogen vacuum engine , RD-57

 

Edited April 22, 2021 by Anachro

@Beale

Some info on an Almaz based space missile if you're interested:

http://www.russianspaceweb.com/almaz-shield2.html

Hello folks.

Another Soyuz rockets fan here; a launcher from which I built a replica using the stock parts. If restock makes it look nicer I wasn't completely satisfied with a few aspects on a pure aesthetical level.

Which is ofc why I installed Tantares. First of all, I'd like to give a shout out to Beale and to all of those who have contributed to this mod directly or indirectly. I didn't expect that amount of parts, so nicely detailed and astutely incorporated to the game "ecosystem". Really neat stuff!

In my attempt to recreate Soyuz (not only the orbital spacecraft but also the launcher) I unfortunately couldn't find those beveled tanks as seen in the folowing image:

 

 

Yet, this part seems to be included in the mod parts as seen on a screenshot by Zorg:

 

Am I missing something? I double checked and I could find the rights tanks except one that is perfectly cylindric (Tantares Size 1.5 Fuel Tank C).

Although there are two shape-fiting parts but with a diameter that do not fit the design (Tantares Size 1.5 to 1 Adapter Tank C & D).

 

Also, along the same lines, I cannot find a similar beveled upper part tank as seen here:

But I guess, I'm just asking way too much here haha. Either way, I know I'm quibbling a bit but what can we do? Perfectionists...

 

Regards, F.

Although there are two shape-fiting parts but with a diameter that do not fit the design (Tantares Size 1.5 to 1 Adapter Tank C & D).

 

Also, along the same lines, I cannot find a similar beveled upper part tank as seen here:

But I guess, I'm just asking way too much here haha. Either way, I know I'm quibbling a bit but what can we do? Perfectionists...

Many thanks, yeah the bevel tanks are in-game, but they are two separate part (just two cones you flip):


The bevel upper tank part is where the fairing base goes - unfortunately we don't have that yet, but it's coming with the Tantares Simple Adjustable Fairing expansion, coming soon (ish):

https://github.com/Tantares/TantaresSAF

(Hint Hint)

They are updating the wiki about the planned orbital station these days.
They added a video (in Russian) with something looking like a module under construction and the posters with phases of with the station development (on video behind the spokespersons).

The left and the middle posters are about first and seconds phases of its development, respectively.

Spoiler

42 minutes ago, kerbiloid said:

something looking like a module under construction

It's NEM(googleable name) - scientific-energetic module. I'm not sure it's in the scope of Tantares, but it's ultimately a Proton fairing-wide MPL with a conic adapter to docking port on one side and a truss with two wide Tantares solars on another. I think it's possible to kitbash it with existing Tantares, Station Parts Expansion Redux and (maybe) Planetside parts.

Meteor 1-10 (Plesetsk)

Meteor 1-10 was launched from Plesetsk at 29 December, 1971.

Meteor satellites were launched on Vostok-2 rocket - which was basically the same rocket that launched Vostok spacecraft.

The conglomeration to the left is Arkhangelsk, a major city and port in Russian Arctic, and Severodvinsk - a major Russian naval base.

Doing Corolev's Cross.

The funniest-looking peninsula on Earth - Kanin!

Novaya Zemlya.

At the intermediate orbit, deploying stuff.

And now, something totally unexpected. Ladies and gentlemen, allow me to introduce 11D82M - a Soviet SOLID APOGEE KICK MOTOR.

This thing originated as Voskhod deorbit motor, and later was adapted as AKM for Vostok-launched satellites. Unfortunately, Tantares does not have it, so I've used BDB to build it.

*wink* *wink* *nudge* *nudge* *hey Beale make the goddamn thing already*

Here it is:

Anyway, back to the satellite.

The reason I chose this particulatr satellite is: it carried prototype Stationary Plasma Thrusters. These were tucked under solar panels, as you can see there:

Just figured, why the Tantares RCS thruster are not working with my crafts. They use liquid fuel and oxidizer?! O_o

Is that intended or do I have some mess on my install?

32 minutes ago, chris-kerbal said:

Just figured, why the Tantares RCS thruster are not working with my crafts. They use liquid fuel and oxidizer?! O_o

Is that intended or do I have some mess on my install?

Yeah this is a very intentional decision, irl they are using bipropellant for rcs thrusters, as a bonus it makes things easier to balance, and actually gives you a lot of flexibility (and hopefully, fun) designing craft.

 

Reworking those FGB adapters to be a little more bulky when blanketed
